conversation.content: [confused] Wait, what is... oh my God. [pause] This is from Mrs. Chen? The—the one who always gets the vanilla latte with extra foam? [gasp softly] She says I... [shaky voice] that my cheerful service helped her through cancer treatment. [pause] Cancer. I didn't even know she was... [sniffle] I mean, I just thought she looked tired sometimes, you know? And I'd throw in an extra shot or draw a little smiley face on her cup because, I don't know, it seemed like... like maybe she needed it? [crying while speaking] But I had no idea she was going through that. [pause] All those mornings when I'd joke about the weather or, um, compliment her scarf or whatever—she says that helped her? [sniffle] That just me being... being myself at six in the morning somehow made her chemo days easier? [very quietly] I can't believe this. [pause] You never really know what people are carrying, do you? [warm] And here I thought I was just, you know, making coffee. But apparently I was... [trailing off] God, this is so much bigger than coffee. [happy] I'm keeping this note forever.

subject: A regular customer left a note saying your cheerful service at the coffee cart helped them through cancer treatment
